result.execSummary:
The defendant Brock E. Hoekstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall pay costs to the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office at a rate of $50/mo commencing 2/15/16 and the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full
Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:05 - Defendant, Brock E. Hoekstra in court, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions to correct on page 3; corrects County to "Green" not "Green Lake". Court accepts amendment. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
